org.apache.felix.ipojo.parser
Class ManifestMetadataParser

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.felix.ipojo.parser.ManifestMetadataParser

public class ManifestMetadataParser
extends java.lang.Object

The Manifest Metadata parser reads a manifest file and builds the iPOJO metadata (Element / Attribute ) structure.

Author:
Felix Project Team

Field Detail

m_elements

private Element[] m_elements
The element list. Contains the element found in the parsed header.

Constructor Detail

ManifestMetadataParser

public ManifestMetadataParser()
Method Detail

getComponentsMetadata

public Element[] getComponentsMetadata()
                                throws ParseException
Gets the array of component type metadata.

Returns:
the component metadata (composite & component). An empty array is returned if no component type declaration.
Throws:
ParseException - if a parsing error occurs

getInstances

public java.util.Dictionary[] getInstances()
                                    throws ParseException
Gets the array of instance configuration described in the metadata.

Returns:
the instances list or null if no instance configuration.
Throws:
ParseException - if the metadata cannot be parsed successfully

parseInstance

private java.util.Dictionary parseInstance(Element instance)
                                    throws ParseException
Parses an Element to create an instance configuration dictionary. The 'name' attribute of the instance declaration is mapped to the 'instance.name' property.

Parameters:
instance - the Element describing an instance.
Returns:
the resulting dictionary
Throws:
ParseException - if a configuration cannot be parse correctly.

parseProperty

private void parseProperty(Element prop,
                           java.util.Dictionary dict)
                    throws ParseException
Parses an instance property. This method is recursive to handle complex properties.

Parameters:
prop - the current element to parse
dict - the dictionary to populate (the future instance configuration)
Throws:
ParseException - if the property cannot be parsed correctly

parseDictionary

private java.util.Dictionary parseDictionary(Element prop)
                                      throws ParseException
Parses a complex property. This property will be built as a Dictionary.

Parameters:
prop - the Element to parse.
Returns:
the resulting dictionary
Throws:
ParseException - if an internal property is incorrect.

parseMap

private java.util.Map parseMap(Element prop)
                        throws ParseException
Parses a complex property. This property will be built as a Map. The used Map implementation is HashMap.

Parameters:
prop - the property to parse
Returns:
the resulting Map
Throws:
ParseException - if an internal property is incorrect.

parseList

private java.util.List parseList(Element prop)
                          throws ParseException
Parses a complex property. This property will be built as a List. The used List implementation is ArrayList. The order of elements is kept.

Parameters:
prop - the property to parse
Returns:
the resulting List
Throws:
ParseException - if an internal property is incorrect.

parseProperty

private void parseProperty(Element prop,
                           java.util.Map map)
                    throws ParseException
Parse a property. This methods handles complex properties.

Parameters:
prop - the current element to parse
map - the map to populate
Throws:
ParseException - if the property cannot be parsed correctly

parseAnonymousProperty

private void parseAnonymousProperty(Element prop,
                                    java.util.List list)
                             throws ParseException
Parse an anonymous property. An anonymous property is a property with no name. An anonymous property can be simple (just a value) or complex (i.e. a map, a dictionary a list or an array).

Parameters:
prop - the property to parse
list - the list to populate with the resulting property
Throws:
ParseException - if an internal property cannot be parse correctly

addElement

private void addElement(Element elem)
Adds an element to the m_elements list.

Parameters:
elem - the the element to add

removeLastElement

private Element removeLastElement()
Removes an element from the m_elements list.

Returns:
an element to remove

parse

public void parse(java.util.Dictionary dict)
           throws ParseException
Looks for the iPOJO-Components header in the given dictionary. Then, initializes the m_elements list (adds the iPOJO root element) and parses the contained component type declarations and instance configurations.

Parameters:
dict - the given headers of the manifest file
Throws:
ParseException - if any error occurs

parseHeader

public void parseHeader(java.lang.String header)
                 throws ParseException
Parses the given header, initialized the m_elements list (adds the iPOJO element) and parses contained component type declarations and instance configurations.

Parameters:
header - the given header of the manifest file
Throws:
ParseException - if any error occurs

parse

public static Element parse(java.lang.String metadata)
                     throws ParseException
Parses the metadata from the string given in argument. This methods creates a new ManifestMetadataParser object and calls the parseElements(String) method. The parsing must result as a tree (only one root element).

Parameters:
metadata - the metadata to parse
Returns:
Element the root element resulting of the parsing
Throws:
ParseException - if any error occurs

parseHeaderMetadata

public static Element parseHeaderMetadata(java.lang.String header)
                                   throws ParseException
Parses the metadata from the given header string. This method creates a new ManifestMetadataParser object and then creates the iPOJO root element, parses content elements (component types and instances declarations), and returns the resulting Element / Attribute structure. The parsed string must be a tree (only one root element).

Parameters:
header - the header to parse
Returns:
Element the root element resulting of the parsing
Throws:
ParseException - if any error occurs

parseElements

private void parseElements(java.lang.String elems)
Parses the given string. This methods populates the m_elements list.

Parameters:
elems - the string to parse
